security_audit.summary: Pure documentation/prompt skill with no executable code. Provides legitimate guidance for integrating error tracking services like Sentry and Rollbar. Static findings are false positives - the scanner misinterpreted code examples as actual execution patterns. The skill only provides guidance, makes no network calls, accesses no credentials, and has no external commands.

content.value_statement: Production errors can be difficult to diagnose without proper monitoring. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for integrating error tracking services like Sentry and Rollbar with error boundaries, breadcrumbs, and context capture.
actual_capabilities: Detects application framework (React, Express, Django, etc.)
Configures error tracking services with best practices
Sets up error boundaries for graceful error handling
Adds user context, tags, and breadcrumbs for better debugging
Configures performance monitoring and transaction tracking
Filters sensitive data before sending to error services
limitations: Does not create accounts or API keys on external services
Does not modify production systems without user approval
Does not access or read existing error tracking data
Provides guidance only, user must implement code changes

use_cases.title: Set up React error boundaries
use_cases.description: Add Sentry or Rollbar to React applications with ErrorBoundary components for graceful crash handling

use_cases.title: Configure Node.js error logging

use_cases.title: Enable production monitoring
use_cases.description: Configure source maps, alerting, and performance monitoring for production error visibility

prompt_templates.title: Basic integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Sentry error tracking to my React application. Include error boundaries and user context.

prompt_templates.title: Backend setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure Sentry for my Express API with request handlers and performance monitoring.

prompt_templates.title: Filter sensitive data
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up PII filtering in Sentry to prevent passwords and tokens from being logged.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up error tracking for a full-stack application with React frontend and Python Django backend.

output_examples.input: Add Sentry to my React app with error boundaries and user context
output: Install the Sentry React SDK: npm install @sentry/react
Initialize Sentry in your app entry point with your DSN and environment
Wrap your app with the ErrorBoundary component for graceful error handling
Add Sentry.setUser() calls when users log in to include user context
Configure beforeSend to filter sensitive data like passwords

output_examples.input: Set up Rollbar for my Express backend
output: Initialize Rollbar with your access token from environment variables
Add Rollbar middleware as the first middleware in your Express app
Use Rollbar.error() or Rollbar.critical() to log errors
Configure ignored messages to reduce noise from known issues

output_examples.input: Configure error tracking for Django with performance monitoring
output: Install Sentry SDK: pip install sentry-sdk
Add sentry-sdk to your INSTALLED_APPS in settings.py
Initialize Sentry with your DSN and environment setting
Use sentry_sdk.init() with performance sampling rate
Add @sentry_span decorator to track slow database queries

best_practices: Use separate projects for development, staging, and production environments
Set appropriate sample rates to balance error coverage and performance
Always filter PII, passwords, and API tokens before sending data to error services
anti_patterns: Logging sensitive user data like passwords, credit cards, or API keys
Sending 100% of transactions in production without sampling
Ignoring browser extension errors that create noise in error reports

faq.question: Which frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports React, Vue, Angular (frontend), Express, Fastify (Node.js), Django, Flask (Python), and Rails (Ruby).

faq.question: What error tracking services work with this skill?
faq.answer: Sentry, Rollbar, Bugsnag, Airbrake, and LogRocket are all covered in the documentation.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill only provides guidance. It does not read files, access credentials, or send data anywhere.

faq.question: How do I get my DSN and API keys?
faq.answer: Create an account on your chosen error tracking service. Find your DSN in the project settings or installation instructions.

faq.question: Can I use multiple error tracking services?
faq.answer: Yes, but it is not recommended. Multiple services increase complexity and may cause duplicate error reports.

faq.question: How is this different from manual setup?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured workflow with best practices, context configuration, and performance monitoring setup.
